content.description:
Good little climb. A relatively wide crack (hands/fist type of thing). You can either climb it as a pure crack (makes it a little harder) or use some face features. After a few pieces, you'll get to a sort of hub into the face that makes for a good rest. The downside being that you'll have a somewhat overhanging crack for the last few moves. This can be well protected before the move with a #3 so nothing too committing. Then you can mantle onto the slab where everyone is hanging out (and likely have to answer a few questions as to how/why you're popping out from below like that). 

It would be excellent if it were longer.

From the 2nd view point at the top of Trail #1 (where everyone is having a snack & photo ops), when you look at the lake, it's basically directly underneath you. Go along the edge of the big slab on the right and eventually you'll find a trail going down. As you go down (the big slab is now above, on our left) you will eventually get to a big, detached flake that forms a ledge with the main wall, leading to a corner with a much larger ledge from which to belay.
Mostly larger stuff. Not very long, super easy to protect at also any point. Great intro into trad lead.
Enter a description of this area.
